item.title: Indo Farm Equipment IPO Listing On Tuesday: Latest GMP Signals Over 43% Listing Gain For Investors - News18
item.description:
Indo Farm Equipment IPO Listing On Tuesday: Latest GMP Signals Over 43% Listing Gain For Investors

Last Updated: January 04, 2025, 21:40 IST

Unlisted shares of Indo Farm Equipment Ltd are currently trading at Rs 308 per share in the grey market, indicating a robust listing gain for investors on January 7.

  • The IPO issue price is Rs 215, showing a 43.26% premium in the grey market.
  • The IPO was significantly oversubscribed by 227.67 times.
  • Retail investors saw a 101.79 times subscription rate.
“Grey market premium indicates investors’ readiness to pay more than the issue price.”

The IPO is expected to have a strong market debut, with both BSE and NSE listing scheduled for January 7.

item.title: Zepto IPO: Company To File Draft Papers In March-April; All You Need To Know - News18
item.description:
Zepto IPO: Company To File Draft Papers In March-April; All You Need To Know

Last Updated: January 04, 2025, 19:32 IST

Zepto, a quick commerce platform, is preparing to file its initial public offering (IPO) draft papers by March or April 2025, following approval to relocate its base from Singapore to India.

  • A critical board meeting on January 19 will discuss IPO specifics, including banker appointments and IPO size.
  • Grey market premium data will be available once IPO preparations begin, with pricing announced shortly before the IPO opening.
  • Zepto is set to become the first quick commerce startup to go public, following competitors like Zomato and Swiggy.
  • The company is shifting to a marketplace model for better quality control and service management.
  • Zepto reported a 120% increase in operating revenue to Rs 4,454 crore in FY24 and aims to expand operations to over 50 cities soon.
Zepto's valuation stands at USD 5 billion following a USD 350 million funding round in November 2024.

The upcoming IPO is a significant step for Zepto in its expansion journey and transformation into a competitive marketplace model.

item.title: Dangerous storm to unleash snow, ice, bitter cold across US - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Dangerous Storm Set to Bring Snow, Ice, and Bitter Cold Across the US

Date: Jan 05, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

A colossal winter storm is set to hit the eastern half of the US, plunging more than 55 million people into a deep freeze with heavy snowfall, frigid temperatures, and hazardous travel conditions.

  • Winter storm warnings issued from Montana to Maryland, Delaware, and Virginia.
  • Heavy lake-effect snow expected in New York and Pennsylvania with totals possibly reaching two feet.
  • Blizzard conditions forecast across Central Plains, with travel being extremely hazardous.
  • Temperatures expected to drop below zero Fahrenheit in some areas, compounded by strong winds.
  • Freezing rain and sleet predicted to create treacherous conditions from Kansas to Virginia.
  • State emergencies declared in Missouri and Virginia due to hazardous weather risks.
Governor Andy Beshear stated, "The storm will likely cause significant disruption and dangerous conditions on our roads and could cause significant power outages just 24 hours before it's going to get really cold in Kentucky."

As the storm approaches, residents are urged to prepare for hazardous conditions and potential power outages.

item.title: 7 amazing images of Nebula captured by NASA - India.com
item.description:
7 Amazing Images of Nebula Captured by NASA

Publication Date: January 2025 Source: India.com

This article showcases stunning images of various nebulas captured by NASA, highlighting their beauty and scientific significance.

  • The Red Spider Nebula is located 3000 light-years away in Sagittarius.
  • The Spirograph Nebula, IC 418, lies 2000 light-years from Earth in Lepus.
  • Light and shadow in the Carina Nebula reveal complex structures.
  • The Twin Jet Nebula is a notable example of a bipolar planetary nebula.
  • The Hourglass Nebula MyCn18 is about 8,000 light-years away and is captured by Hubble.
  • The Crab Nebula offers the most detailed views ever.
  • A nebula resembling a butterfly is detailed for its unique shape.
"The Crab Nebula is among the most interesting and well-studied objects in astronomy."

The images celebrate the wonders of the universe and the role of NASA in cosmic exploration.

item.title: Kiara Advani Advised Rest Due to Exertion, Misses Game Changer Event with Ram Charan - News18
item.description:
Kiara Advani Takes a Break Due to Exhaustion, Misses Game Changer Event

Date: January 04, 2025

Source: News18

Actress Kiara Advani, set to star alongside Ram Charan in the film Game Changer, is currently resting at home following advice to recover from exhaustion after a busy schedule.

  • Ian a surprising turn, Kiara was initially reported to be hospitalized, but her spokesperson clarified she is at home resting.
  • Her absence was noted at a promotional event for Game Changer, generating concern among fans.
  • The film, directed by Shankar, is set to release on January 10, 2025.
  • Game Changer has completed its censorship formalities and received a U/A certificate from the CBFC.
“Kiara Advani has not been hospitalised, she’s been advised to rest due to exertion as she’s been working non-stop,” said the actress’ spokesperson.

The upcoming film Game Changer has created significant buzz and features an impressive cast, including Ram Charan, making it one of the most anticipated releases of the month.

item.title: Couch potatoes beware! Sitting too much may lead to 19 serious health problems - The Times of India
item.description:
Couch potatoes beware! Sitting too much may lead to 19 serious health problems

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Not specified

The dangers of a sedentary lifestyle are well-known, but a new study reveals a startling connection to 19 chronic conditions, urging individuals to adopt healthier habits.

  • The University of Iowa conducted a study on over 40,000 patients, linking inactivity to increased health risks.
  • Only 60% of respondents met the recommended exercise guidelines.
  • Active individuals showed significantly lower rates of obesity, depression, and hypertension.
  • Patients with no physical activity had an average of 2.16 chronic conditions compared to 1.17 in active individuals.
  • Chronic health conditions related to a sedentary lifestyle include obesity, diabetes, heart issues, and more.
  • Tips to overcome sedentary habits include regular breaks, incorporating exercise into daily routines, and setting activity goals.
“This two-question survey typically takes fewer than 30 seconds for a patient to complete, so it doesn’t interfere with their visit. But it can tell us a whole lot about that patient’s overall health.” - Lucas Carr

Increasing awareness about the effects of inactivity is crucial. Through lifestyle changes, individuals can significantly improve their health and mitigate associated risks.

item.title: Apple Intelligence now takes up almost twice as much room on your iPhone as it used to - TechRadar
item.description:
Apple Intelligence now takes up almost twice as much room on your iPhone as it used to

Date: January 3, 2025
Source: TechRadar

Apple Intelligence now requires 7GB of storage with the new iOS 18.2 update, up from 4GB in the previous version, due to added features and expected further increases in the future.

  • Apple Intelligence now needs 7GB, an increase from 4GB.
  • This increase is attributed to new features in iOS 18.2.
  • Future requirements are projected to grow further.
"If you're running low on storage space on your device, then you may have to think twice about having Apple Intelligence enabled."

Apple's focus on local AI processing enhances privacy but poses storage challenges for users. Those needing to manage their device's space may need to reconsider their use of Apple Intelligence.

item.title: Yuzvendra Chahal shares cryptic post amid divorce rumours with Dhanashree Verma - India Today
item.description:
Yuzvendra Chahal's Cryptic Post Fuels Divorce Rumours with Dhanashree Verma

Published On: Jan 4, 2025 | Published By: Diya Kakkar

Indian cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal has sparked speculation about his marriage to Dhanashree Verma with a cryptic Instagram post, amid reports of their potential separation.

  • Chahal shared a cryptic message on Instagram, possibly reflecting on his personal struggles.
  • Reports indicate that Chahal and Dhanashree have unfollowed each other and deleted shared photos, which has intensified divorce speculations.
  • Sources suggest they have been living separately for months and their marriage appears to be crumbling.
  • The couple married in December 2020 after meeting during the pandemic.
“Hard work spotlights the character of people. You know your journey. You know your pain…”

The ongoing silence from both parties regarding the rumors leaves fans uncertain about the future of their relationship.

item.title: Why is the rupee weakening against the dollar?: Explained - The Hindu
item.description:
Why is the rupee weakening against the dollar?: Explained

Published: January 04, 2025, 11:05 pm IST

The article discusses the recent depreciation of the Indian rupee against the U.S. dollar, attributed mainly to foreign investor withdrawals and prevailing economic conditions.

  • The rupee breached the 85 mark against the U.S. dollar, reaching an all-time low of 85.81.
  • Factors affecting currency depreciation include monetary policy, foreign demand for goods, and inflation rates.
  • The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has intervened to support the rupee but foreign exchange reserves are at an eight-month low of $640 billion.
  • Long-term trends show the rupee's gradual depreciation is tied to high inflation rates compared to the U.S.
“Analysts believe the rupee’s depreciation would have been far worse if not for the RBI’s intervention to support the rupee against the dollar.”

In conclusion, the rupee's current depreciation reflects broader economic trends, investor behavior, and international monetary policy shifts, with implications for India's economic stability.

item.title: New Orleans attacker stored bomb materials, reserved truck weeks ahead, say officials - The Times of India
item.description:
New Orleans attacker stored bomb materials, reserved truck weeks ahead, say officials

Publication Date: [Date of publication not provided], Source: [Source not provided]

This article discusses the recent developments in the investigation surrounding a New Orleans attacker who had stored bomb materials and reserved a truck weeks before the attack.

  • The attacker had been accumulating bomb-making materials over a significant period.
  • A truck was reserved in advance, indicating premeditation.
  • Officials are investigating potential motives and connections.
“The planning involved shows a concerning level of intent,” said a law enforcement official.

The incident raises alarms about security measures and public safety in the region.

item.title: 'Went here and there…': On Lalu Yadav's offer, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar says won't repeat ‘mistake’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Nitish Kumar Rejects Lalu Yadav's Alliance Offer, Reflects on Bihar's Progress

Date: Jan 04, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar criticizes the previous government led by Lalu Prasad Yadav while rejecting an alliance offer, emphasizing Bihar's development since 2005.

  • Nitish Kumar attacks Lalu Prasad's government pre-2005, citing poor conditions in Bihar.
  • He highlights significant improvements in education, health, and infrastructure under his leadership.
  • Kumar's review meeting underscores commitment to continuing development without alliances.
  • Lalu Yadav extended an invitation for partnership in the 'Mahagathbandan', but Kumar declined.
  • Tejashwi Yadav, Lalu's son, downplays Lalu's invitation, suggesting it was merely a response to media inquiries.
“Before the year 2005, Bihar ki halat kaafi kharab thi (the condition of Bihar was really bad).” - Nitish Kumar

Kumar's remarks underline a significant political divide in Bihar as he positions himself as a leader focused on development without reliance on past alliances.

item.title: Aubrey Plaza’s husband, director Jeff Baena, 47, dies by suicide - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Aubrey Plaza's Husband Jeff Baena Dies by Suicide at Age 47

Date: January 04, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Aubrey Plaza is mourning the loss of her husband, film director Jeff Baena, who was found dead in his Los Angeles home at the age of 47. Local authorities are currently investigating the circumstances surrounding his passing.

  • Jeff Baena was discovered dead by his assistant, prompting a police investigation.
  • Aubrey Plaza's representatives stated that the family is devastated and requests privacy.
  • The couple married in 2021 and had no children.
  • Baena's notable works include Joshy, Horse Girl, and co-writing I Heart Huckabees.
  • Plaza mentioned their spontaneous wedding during an appearance on The Ellen DeGeneres Show.
“The family is devastated and asks for privacy at this difficult time.”

This story is still developing as details emerge about Jeff Baena's death.

item.title: Dense fog engulfs Delhi; flight operations hit at IGI airport - The Hindu
item.description:
Dense Fog Engulfs Delhi; Flight Operations Hit at IGI Airport

Date: January 04, 2025 Source: Unknown

Nearly 500 flights faced disruptions at Indira Gandhi International Airport due to severe fog impacting northern India.

The dense fog has resulted in significant travel delays and cancellations, severely impacting air traffic across multiple states.

  • 412 flights delayed by over 45 minutes.
  • 45 flights cancelled due to poor weather conditions.
  • 19 flights diverted to alternate airports.
  • Zero visibility reported in New Delhi, especially between 11:30 p.m. and 8:30 a.m.
  • Intense fog conditions affected flights in multiple northern cities, including Chandigarh and Srinagar.
“Dense fog causing low visibility in northern belt continues to impact flight operations even during daytime hours,” - IndiGo.

This weather phenomenon underscores the ongoing challenges posed by extreme fog in the winter months, emphasizing the need for improved infrastructural responses to such disruptions.

item.title: Why public health nutrition policies need novelty, precise targeting - The Hindu
item.description:
Why public health nutrition policies need novelty, precise targeting

Date: January 04, 2025 Source: The Lancet

This article discusses the slow progress toward achieving Global Nutrition Targets (GNTs) for maternal and child nutrition, emphasizing the need for innovative approaches and precise targeting to address both undernutrition and overnutrition.

  • Global Nutrition Targets aim to alleviate maternal and child malnutrition, with specific goals for stunting, anaemia, and overweight.
  • A recent evaluation indicated insufficient progress in 204 countries from 2012 to 2021, projecting few nations will meet the targets by 2030.
  • Key reasons for slow progress include poor program implementation and inadequate understanding of anaemia causes in India.
  • Children are at risk of metabolic overnutrition, emphasizing the need for dual focus on both undernutrition and overnutrition.
  • Current policies need to diversify dietary approaches rather than solely focusing on specific nutrients.
"The need of the hour is to zealously and precisely focus on double duty actions to simultaneously address the under- and over-nutrition burden."

In conclusion, the effectiveness of public health nutrition policies requires a novel approach that considers the complexities of nutrition, addressing both deficiencies and excesses to foster healthier outcomes for future generations.

item.title: Janhvi Kapoor visits Tirumala Temple with rumoured boyfriend Shikhar Pahariya. Watch - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Janhvi Kapoor Visits Tirumala Temple with Rumoured Boyfriend Shikhar Pahariya

Date: Jan 04, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Bollywood actor Janhvi Kapoor visited the Tirumala Temple to seek blessings, accompanied by her rumored boyfriend Shikhar Pahariya. She greeted her fans while leaving the temple and is set to star in the upcoming film 'Param Sundari'.

  • Janhvi wore a purple saree during her visit.
  • She was surrounded by security and fans.
  • Upcoming movie 'Param Sundari' is a cross-cultural love story with Sidharth Malhotra, releasing on July 25, 2025.
  • First-look posters of the film have been shared on social media.
“North ka swag, South ki grace - two worlds collide and spark fly.”

The visit highlights Janhvi Kapoor's connection to her fans and her upcoming cinematic projects.

item.title: Need to establish 5-6 more cooperatives like Amul: PM Modi - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Need to establish 5-6 more cooperatives like Amul: PM Modi

Published on: 04 January 2025, 16:10 IST

In a speech at the Grameen Bharat Mahotsav, Prime Minister Narendra Modi emphasized the need to create additional large cooperatives similar to Amul, which he noted provides high returns to farmers.

  • Modi called for the establishment of 5-6 more national cooperatives akin to Amul.
  • He highlighted Amul's success with a turnover of Rs 80,000 crore in 2023-24.
  • The Prime Minister urged for more Farmer Producer Organizations (FPOs) to ensure better prices for farmers.
  • According to Modi, 25 crore people have been lifted out of poverty in the last decade.
  • The event was organized to focus on building a resilient rural India by 2047.
“For the first time since independence, the expenditure on food in rural areas has fallen below 50%,” Modi stated, noting a positive shift in consumption patterns.

The Prime Minister's call to action aims to enhance agricultural productivity and improve farmers' economic conditions, reinforcing the government's commitment to rural development.

item.title: Aubrey Plaza said she was 'proud' of husband Jeff Baena in last Instagram post before his death - The Mirror US
item.description:
Aubrey Plaza said she was 'proud' of husband in last post before his death

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: The Mirror

Aubrey Plaza expressed her affection and pride for her husband Jeff Baena in an Instagram post just before his untimely death at 47.

  • Jeff Baena was found dead in their Los Angeles home on Friday.
  • Aubrey's last Instagram post in May 2021 highlighted her pride in Jeff's movie projects.
  • Law enforcement continues to investigate the cause of Jeff's death.
  • Tributes from fans express condolences and sadness over his passing.
“So proud of my darling husband @jeffbaena for dreaming up another film that takes us to Italia to cause some more trouble,” said Aubrey in her last post.

This tragic event highlights the sudden loss that can impact loved ones. Aubrey's heartfelt words bring attention to the profound relationships we cherish.

item.title: Why Modi govt 3.0 is maintaining an arm’s length from protesting farmers - The Indian Express
item.description:
Why Modi govt 3.0 is maintaining an arm’s length from protesting farmers

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Indian Express

Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan has indicated a distant approach from the ongoing farmers' protests led by the Samyukta Kisan Morcha and Kisan Mazdoor Morcha, unlike the proactive measures taken during Modi's previous term.

  • Farmers have been protesting since February 2024 at the Punjab-Haryana borders, demanding legal status for Minimum Support Price (MSP) and a farm debt waiver.
  • Chouhan has extended an open invitation for talks, yet has not engaged directly with the protesting farmers.
  • The government's previous attempts to resolve farmer grievances, particularly in 2020-21, led to escalated tensions and prolonged protests.
  • Current protests are more localized and lack the broad unity seen in earlier movements.
  • Jagjit Singh Dallewal, president of BKU Sidhupur, is on a hunger strike demanding response to farmers' issues from the government.
“Currently, the Supreme Court is looking into this issue. Whatever directives the Supreme Court gives, will be followed.” - Shivraj Singh Chouhan

This current strategy marks a significant shift in the government's handling of farmer-related issues, emphasizing a more detached stance in contrast to previous direct engagements.

item.title: Atul Subhash suicide case: Wife Nikita Singhania, her mother and brother get bail - The Times of India
item.description:
Nikita Singhania, Family Granted Bail in Atul Subhash Suicide Case

Date: January 4, 2025
Source: Times of India

Nikita Singhania, the wife of Atul Subhash who allegedly committed suicide, along with her mother and brother, have been granted bail in the case. The Mumbai Sessions Court granted them bail on Tuesday, January 3, 2025.

  • The court set a bail bond of Rs 10,000 each for Nikita and her family.
  • The court also imposed certain conditions, including that they do not leave the country without prior permission and that they cooperate with the investigation.

The court observed that the accused are not likely to abscond and will cooperate with the investigation.

The next hearing in the case is scheduled for February 15, 2025.
